items.content_html: LLRT (Low Latency Runtime) is an experimental, lightweight JavaScript runtime designed to address the growing demand for fast and efficient Serverless applications.

items.content_html: This project aims to achieve something similar to Function as a Service (FaaS) without the overhead of Docker or Kubernetes, with extremely low infrastructure requirements.
items.title: shreyasnayak/nodejs-faas:  This project aims to achieve something similar to Function as a Service (FaaS) without the overhead of Docker or Kubernetes, with extremely low infrastructure requirements.

items.content_html: A lightweight NPM package that offers various helpers around the native Fetch API to perform GraphQL requests towards DatoCMS CDA.
items.title: datocms/cda-client: A lightweight NPM package that offers various helpers around the native Fetch API to perform GraphQL requests towards DatoCMS CDA.

items.content_html: The react-toast-lite is a lightweight, easy-to-use toast notification component for React applications. It provides a simple way to display brief messages in the form of toast notifications, which can be used to inform users about the success, error, or status of an operation.
items.title: aamarnathkp/react-toast-lite: The react-toast-lite is a lightweight, easy-to-use toast notification component for React applications. It provides a simple way to display brief messages in the form of toast notifications, which can be used to inform users about the success, error, or status of an operation.

items.content_html: Enigma is a lightweight nodeJS application to store environment variable securely and transfer though API. Very useful to update, pass to ECS and easy to manage. You can also run it to aws:lambda for production preferred and heroku for testing/sandbox env.
items.title: divamtech/enigma: Enigma is a lightweight nodeJS application to store environment variable securely and transfer though API. Very useful to update, pass to ECS and easy to manage. You can also run it to aws:lambda for production preferred and heroku for testing/sandbox env.
